Hi everyone,
I'm encountering an issue with the `crm/v3/objects/deals/splits/batch/read` endpoint. Specifically, the `HubSpot_owner_id` returned in the response is a 10-digit number, whereas the documentation suggests it should be 8 digits.
Could someone clarify why this discrepancy might occur? Also, is there a way to retrieve the 8-digit `HubSpot_owner_id`?

Hi Everyone,
I would like to know if is it possible to pre-authenticate access to the Help Desk Customer Portal. I have an application which I would like to provide support via HubSpot Help Desk. My users authenticate into my application and I would like them *not have to* reauthenticate into the Help Desk Customer Portal which I will link from within my application. Is that possible? Has anyone done this before or know how to do it?
Thanks in advance :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello team,

I was wondering if you could help me with a use case.

Let me explain my situation. I have a DMS where I’d like to retrieve appointments using an internal ID and the contact's email. I want to set up a daily cron job to pull in all new appointments and create or update them as deals, using the “<http://Hello%20team,%20%20I%20was%20wondering%20if%20you%20could%20help%20me%20with%20a%20use%20case.%20%20Let%20me%20explain%20my%20situation.%20I%20have%20a%20DMS%20where%20I’d%20like%20to%20retrieve%20appointments%20using%20an%20internal%20ID%20and%20the%20contact's%20email.%20I%20want%20to%20set%20up%20a%20daily%20cron%20job%20to%20pull%20in%20all%20new%20appointments%20and%20create%20or%20update%20them%20as%20deals,%20using%20the%20“POST%20Create%20or%20update%20a%20batch%20of%20deals%20by%20unique%20property%20values”%20endpoint,%20where%20I%20would%20use%20the%20appointment%20ID%20as%20the%20unique%20property.%20However,%20I’m%20not%20sure%20how%20to%20associate%20the%20contacts%20with%20these%20deals,%20as%20this%20POST%20request%20doesn’t%20support%20associating%20another%20object.|POST Create or update a batch of deals by unique property values>” endpoint, where I would use the appointment ID as the unique property. However, I’m not sure how to associate the contacts with these deals, as this POST request doesn’t support associating another object.

Any other idea? I would like to use Workflows and Custom code to do this
<@U01QVR44MEY> Could you please help me with this? Thanks in advance

Hey all!

We are currently sending over all contacts to HubSpot via the Contact API. We’ve just been notified that they are missing the hutk cookie information and a lot of the referral info from the user.

We are wondering the best way to unify the anonymous users browsing behavior before signing up for our app, with the contact we create via the API.

Can this be used to help tie the anonymous user with the record we created once the user signed up for our software?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/conversations/visitor-identification>

I see there are recommendations to use HubSpot Forms and others that say I should use the javascript library with the identify command.

The flow is as follows
1. Visitor lands on our site
2. At some point they signup for app (but we cannot use HubSpot Forms due to password TOS)
3. We then create the contact on the backend using the API

This makes marketing miss critical visitor entrance and browsing behavior.

Ideally we’d like to avoid having to use the Forms API if there is another way to connect this data to the contact we create.

This would probably be easier to do in a chat or call so let me know if that’s possible.

*Contacts*

`<form action="/{{ site_settings.content_search_results_page_path }}" >...</form>`

In our blog-listing template, we are using the built-in HubSpot site search input. This passes the querystring *?q=userterm* to the search results page and is not returning results.
  `{% module "module_173037341670656" path="@HubSpot/search_input", label="search_input.module", content_types="blog_posts" %}`

Why is one sending "term" and the other "q"?  What do I need to modify?
